[[Image:Linguaphone - At the Tobacconist (Tolkien).png|thumb|"At the Tobacconist's"]]
'''''Linguaphone Conversational Course''''' is an English language course originally released in [[1930]] as a set of [[Wikipedia:Gramophone record#Speeds|78 rpm records]] by the Linguaphone Institute of London. [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] read parts of Lesson 20 "At the Tobacconist's" and Lesson 30 "Wireless", which is the earliest known recording of his voice.<ref name=CG>{{CG|RG}}, p. 822</ref> Tolkien made the recording in July [[1929]].<ref>{{webcite|author=|articleurl=http://www.hammondandscull.com/addenda/chronology.html|articlename=Addenda and Corrigenda to ''The J.R.R. Tolkien Companion and Guide'' (2006) Vol. 1: Chronology|dated=|website=HS|accessed=18 February 2012}}</ref>
